events.message: The client reported their car was involved in a collision at an intersection, resulting in visible damage to the front bumper and hood.
Based on the report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident since the incident involved the insured vehicle.
A claims agent was assigned to handle this case and to guide the client through the claim process and necessary documentation.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the claimant received confirmation along with initial instructions on next steps.
The insurance company requested the submission of the accident report, vehicle photos, and a copy of the driver’s license for processing.
The customer provided all requested documents including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a medical note for minor injuries.
The investigation team initiated a thorough review of the accident circumstances and verified the submitted evidence and reports.
Investigation concluded confirming that the client was not at fault and the damages assessed matched the claim details.
A settlement offer was made to the claimant covering the repair costs and additional compensation for inconvenience.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the communication and timeliness of the offer.
The claim was formally approved after acceptance of the settlement term by the claimant without any objections.
Payment covering repair costs and agreed compensation was issued promptly and transferred to the claimant’s account.
The claim case was officially closed after confirming successful payment and client satisfaction with the resolution.
